info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:07PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Carbon and southwestern Monroe Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1107 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Mahoning, or near Lehighton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Nesquehoning, Weatherly, New Mahoning, Gilbert, Lake Harmony, Albrightsville, Kresgeville, Jonas, Meckesville, Beltzville State Park, Blakeslee, Penn Forest Reservoir, Christmans, Brodheadsville, Lansford, Summit Hill and Bowmanstown. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 72 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 287. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
